pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.10: See Bu Ss 13:2.16 for the meaning of suṇanti in this context.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.53: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as at Bu Ss 10:2.65, the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that in these contexts dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.3.5: By editorial mistake the Pali is missing ādikammikassa, “the first offender”. This is a universal exception that applies to all the rules of the Vinaya.
